result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Thelma Y Riley in court.  Attorney Joel H. Rosenthal in court for Thelma Y Riley.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law. Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed by 11/09/2022. Case is adjourned in Branch 13.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.
CORRECTION: Judge Konkol presided over Branch 13 on August 30th, 2022

Defendant Thelma Y Riley in court.  Attorney Joel H. Rosenthal in court for Thelma Y Riley.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a pre-trial conference. Defense counsel recently appointed. Defense in receipt of discovery but no offer.
Case adjourned.
Status conference scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 8/10/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

ADDRESS INFO for Thelma Y Riley
Current: 5167 N Lovers Lanes Rd, Milwaukee, WI 53225   (Effective: 08-11-2022)
Prior: 6809 North 60th Street, #103, Milwaukee, WI 53223

Defendant Thelma Y Riley in court.    Abigail Doweiko, under the student practice rule, appeared with A.D.A. Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Reserve Judge , Branch 13.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible.  
The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 13.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with SH,PC,QL and ES.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 08/08/2022@2pm
